theoryTitle: Dragon Controls Weather and Caused the Loguetown Storm
theoryText: Dragon has weather manipulation abilities, possibly from a Devil Fruit like the Storm-Storm Fruit or Wind-Wind Fruit. The unnatural storm that arrived precisely when Luffy needed to escape, combined with the green wind phenomenon, suggests Dragon intentionally created these conditions to save his son.
author: Multiple One Piece Community Members

source.title: Did Dragon cause the lightning at Lougetown?

theoryTitle: Dragon Has the Wind-Wind Fruit (Kaze Kaze no Mi)
theoryText: The green wind that appeared in Loguetown and helped the Straw Hats escape is direct evidence of Dragon possessing wind manipulation powers through a Devil Fruit. The theory suggests he has the Kaze Kaze no Mi (Wind-Wind Fruit) which allows him to create and control wind, explaining both the green gust and the sudden storm.
author: One Piece Fan Community

source.title: One Piece: Dragon's Wind Wind Fruit, Explained

theoryTitle: The Lightning Was Natural, Not Caused by Dragon
theoryText: While Dragon may have caused the storm through weather powers or powerful Haki that altered the climate, the specific lightning bolt that struck Buggy was natural coincidence rather than a targeted attack. This theory suggests Dragon's powers extend to creating storms but not precise lightning control.
author: One Piece Theory Community

source.title: Did Dragon cause the lightning at Lougetown?

theoryTitle: Dragon Used Haki to Create the Storm
theoryText: Rather than having a weather-based Devil Fruit, Dragon's immense Haki is so powerful that releasing it can alter the climate and create storms. This would explain the storm's appearance without requiring a specific Devil Fruit ability, similar to how powerful Conqueror's Haki can affect the environment.
author: One Piece Fan Theorists

source.title: Did Dragon cause the lightning at Lougetown?

theoryTitle: Dragon Went to Loguetown Specifically to Watch Luffy Depart
theoryText: Dragon's presence in Loguetown wasn't coincidental - he intentionally came to witness his son's departure for the Grand Line, following in Gol D. Roger's footsteps. This suggests Dragon has been watching Luffy's journey from afar and appears at critical moments to ensure his success.
author: One Piece Wiki Community

source.title: Monkey D. Dragon - One Piece Wiki

theoryTitle: The Vow Ceremony Foreshadows Each Member's Ultimate Achievement
theoryText: The Grand Line vow ceremony where each Straw Hat declares their dream is not just symbolic but foreshadows their eventual success. Each member placing their foot on the barrel and making their declaration will eventually come true, making this scene a prophecy for the series' endgame.
author: One Piece Fan Community
